rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We did a 4 week stay at Danielle’s rental, and we were so grateful we chose her place.
Even more comfortable and well thought out items and design for guests than the pictures let on. Downtown was walkable! Even if you aren’t much on walking there is a convenience store and a couple of restaurants right around the corner.
Communication was great the whole time.
Mattresses were great. Kitchen was stocked well with dishes, cookware, and utensils.
We were slightly concerned with the heat (as it’s a wall unit in the living room) and a lot of our stay was in the 20°s, but it worked well for the house! Especially with the small space heater provided and the nice fact that the bathroom had a heater switch.
We are hoping to rent here again in the future.

review_text: This is a great little house but with plenty of room for the three of us. It is nicely furnished and the beds are very comfortable. It is a remodeled older home, and the work has really been well done. Very thoughtful touches. The neighborhood is close to things and is a real mix of homes that are cute and homes that aren't really maintained, but that is the flavor of Klamath Falls even in the "nicer" neighborhoods, so it is not a negative here. It is just an observation. Overall, this house is wonderful and a very nice place to stay. Danielle is a very responsive host and is so friendly with her messaging and checking in on her guests. It makes you feel cared for even if you don't get to meet in person! A great spot to stay.

We would absolutely recommend Danielle’s place to stay!

We couldn't stay more than 1 day, but it would be easy to live here for an extended period, & we intend to do that as soon as we can. The house & location has everything needed for enjoying a life that is normally not available to city dwellers. Melody was not visible, but responded immediately to questions. We felt like we were staying in a beloved friends home while she was away.

Dear Melody,
I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt gratitude for the incredible Airbnb experience you provided. From the moment I arrived, I was blown away by the cleanliness and organization of your space. It was evident that you take great pride in maintaining a peaceful and serene environment for your guests.
Every detail, from the perfectly arranged furniture to the spotless bathroom, showcased your dedication to creating a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. It was a pleasure to relax and unwind in such a well-maintained space.
Your attention to detail and commitment to cleanliness truly set you apart. It was a breath of fresh air to stay in an Airbnb that was not only aesthetically pleasing but also impeccably clean. I cannot thank you enough for the effort you put into ensuring a pleasant and enjoyable stay.
I am grateful for the peace and tranquility I experienced during my time at your Airbnb. It was a much-needed escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday

review_text: This place was a gem. My 9 year old and I were passing through back home to Boise, ID from the CA coast. This was far more comfortable and cozy than a hotel. Instantly felt right at home. The personal touches made us feel welcomed and exceptionally comfortable. We only stayed one night and it was a little chilly and rainy, otherwise we would have went on a walk. The area is peaceful and the sunset was lovely. We had our suitcases and more than we needed, but for someone passing through, whether it's a random toiletrie, cup of tea or snack, everything was there making it so simple to stay overnight or longer. Much appreciated the thoughtful card made out to us. Highly suggest staying if just passing through, or wanting to get away and clear your mind. Melody has a heart to serve and offer true hospitality. We signed the guestbook which was full of raving reviews. Bring a cooler for homegrown goodies in the fridge and freezer. Mine was full already. Worth the stay!

review_text: This standalone house on a little farm plot on the outskirts of Klamath Falls made for a welcome and comfortable stay. Chickens from one of the many coops on the property cluck and peck around, overlooked by pleasant views of the surrounding landscape. The property is located just a few minutes away from downtown, yet it feels removed enough to feel like a proper getaway. The space is well-decorated and supplied with just about everything you need to make meals, relax, and share time with loved ones. You can get out for a bit of a hike on the property or just kick back. Melody's communication is responsive, and she's willing to help make sure your visit is comfortable. The availability of fresh-laid eggs to take home is a huge plus! We'd love to return.

review_text:
Loved, loved, loved Melody’s place! We were taking a quick side trip to see my husband’s home town after being gone for 30 years. It was perfect. Wish we needed to go to Klamath Falls more often just so we could stay there.
It’s much better than the pictures show. We got to visit with deer during morning coffee on the deck and chickens all day long. They are very well behaved.🥰
The snacks, half and half, coffee, apples, eggs and more were much more than expected but much appreciated. We purchased meat and eggs to take back to in laws in Portland. The meat stayed frozen wrapped in paper during our flight back to Kansas City. Can’t wait to cook it!
Also, the Wi-Fi worked great in the living room and bedroom during our planned Zoom meetings.
The only thing to know is it’s a bit tricky getting onto 97 headed to town from the property’s street. Be careful.
Wonderful stay!

review_text:
Melody's farmhouse is a testament to her impeccable taste and attention to detail. The tranquil ambiance, combined with the authentic farm-style décor, created a retreat that truly exceeded my expectations. It was an experience that left me pleasantly surprised and utterly enchanted.
The cozy couch in Melody's home was a true haven of comfort and relaxation. Its inviting embrace and warm embrace made for the perfect spot to unwind and take in the peaceful surroundings.
Melody's warm and gracious hospitality, paired with the genuine charm of her farmhouse, made my stay a truly exceptional experience. I wholeheartedly recommend her property to anyone seeking a lovely escape to the countryside. Melody's place is a hidden gem that promises delightful surprises at every turn. Thank you, Melody, for opening your beautiful home to guests like me and for sharing your piece of paradise with the world

name: James
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We can’t believe how lucky we were to snag the Sunset Ranch for our stay in Klamath Falls! We drove down from where we live on the Olympic Peninsula to see the ring of fire solar eclipse in Libra, but was tempted to extend our stay to explore the area more.
This little farmhouse cottage is as clean, new, and comfortable as it is quiet, charming and quaint. The property provides solitude, dark skies, waking trail, and beautiful views and happy chickens, whose delectable eggs are available for a modest amount in the fridge (brilliant!).
The best part, though, was how conveniently situated it was not just to the gorgeous country, but to the small-town charm of Klamath Falls. The place itself is less than ten minutes from town and tucked away on a back country road, which only took us a minute to find. Our hosts were very responsive and sent us hiking suggestions and even mailed back our thermos that we forgot. We could not be more grateful for this little gem of a place! Thank you!!!

review_text: I was in Klamath Falls for work and was just looking for a basic place to stay, but this turned out to be totally amazing and made my work trip feel like a vacation. Melody and her family went above and beyond to make me feel welcome! The tea selection, fresh flowers, local (i.e. backyard-local) beef in the freezer, fresh eggs, and directions for walking up the trails were just totally phenomenal. The space was comfortable, clean, welcoming, and perfect for being able to cook and unwind while I was in town for a few days. When I needed to change my plans, Melody was responsive, accommodating, and friendly. Highly, highly recommend this place!

Melody’s property it beautiful, per her suggestion, I took a short stroll behind the property in the evening and got a gorgeous view of Klamath Lake. The guesthouse was clean, quiet had all the amenities I needed. It was stocked with coffee, snacks and farm fresh eggs. If I’m headed this way again I would definitely stay here and would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a peaceful place to stay in the area that is super affordable. Thank you!

review_text: We had a wonderful stay at L’s place! He was accommodating, communicative, and such a fantastic host. The home is very charming and beautifully maintained. Our stay was comfortable and peaceful which is exactly what we needed as I was traveling for work. Some of the things I really loved were the historical photos of Klamath Falls, the sweet backyard, and airy feeling in the home. But really, we loved everything about it. The neighborhood is one of my favorites in town and a great place to walk the dog. A new favorite place to stay when traveling for work or to see family.

name: Amy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: It is a great little house in a safe, quiet beautiful suburb of Klamath Falls and its very easy to get to. We found parking to be crowded next to a big truck in the back of the shared driveway, but actually the street parking right in front of a little lawn up to the front door was perfect and always available. It's easier to move the luggage in through the front door. The inside is extremely cute and comfortable and everything worked just fine. We used the a/c just a little bit and it was perfect. The place was very well stocked in every room, especially the kitchen and bathroom. It's all updated and it's easy to figure everything out. The bed in one room is very comfortable and feels new. The living room is small, but very cozy and warm for a few people. We made a couple suggestions to the host by email and he responded right away and was very gracious in taking constructive criticism. Also, the 4:00 pm check in/10:00 am check out could be more generous. We loved our stay here! :)

review_text: L's place is a beautiful little home that is even better in person than the pictures. The neighborhood that it is in is the best part of Klamath falls, and it's a beautiful place to go for a stroll and walk your dog. There are so many wonderful spaces in the house to relax, including a back patio, a beautiful front porch, and spacious living areas inside. We especially loved the kitchen and the living room. We stayed here for 3 months and wish we could have stayed longer. L is extremely responsive, and was accommodating with anything that we needed. I highly recommend staying here!

review_text: I’ll start by saying that I’ve avoided renting rooms attached to a house before, but am so glad I booked this place after reviewing the comments. The view and deck were simply amazing. Even being attached to the main house, the private walkway and entry offered seclusion and privacy. I did meet Del, and he was friendly and helpful. Thanks to the hosts for being very responsive and welcoming to my last minute reservation. Their communication was perfect, and I was pleasantly surprised by the items provided from coffee to snacks, utensils, and even paper plates. I enjoyed breakfast on the deck with the birds and that amazing view. I would highly recommend this listing for a single person or a couple looking to stay in a beautiful setting a bit away from the town.

review_text: We’ve always stayed at another AirBnB when visiting relatives in Klamath Falls before but were unable to book it this time—fortunately for us. Country Haven is a special place—clean, comfortable, private and spacious. We loved spending mornings on the front porch drinking our coffee and watching the birds. Judy and Del have put a lot of thought into it and paid attention to a details many hosts don’t. We had a nice chat with them upon our arrival and found them to be friendly, genuine hosts. We highly recommend staying here and hope we’re able to when we visit in Klamath again.

Listen and it’s read! Worth it!
Do you know how you never know what you’re gonna get when you stay at an Airbnb?
You will not need to worry with this place! It is located outside of town in the country, and it is extremely quiet and peaceful. There is no weirdness about this place and it just feels comfortable. Everything you can need and more I will 100% stay at this place again.
It is like staying in a middle-class home, and the entire part of the home you stay in is private.
There was some things in there that I never expected, but found fun like a Rubiks cube, and two umbrellas. There was so much more to help cover any needs you might have.
Again, I strongly recommend staying at this place!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Going back to my hometown evoked mixed feelings….memories, and even anxiety. However, upon arriving and checking into Del and Judy’s place, I felt more at ease. Very inviting, comfortable, and clearly every detail had been thought out carefully. In the morning, when we met Del and Judy, it was like talking to old friends. Judy, surprised me with a county journal publication from the year I graduated from the local high school. Talk about an extra touch of walking down memory lane. It really meant so much.
Their place truly was one of the best places I’ve stayed and they, as the hosts, made it so special. I would whole heartedly recommend this place to anyone that is traveling to Klamath. The views were spectacular, the treats were appreciated, the wildlife was an added bonus. Extra claps for the Rooster. :O)
Thank you Del and Judy, for sharing your perfect Country Haven with us. We will definitely be back and I very much look forward to seeing you two again. Thanks!

To top it all off, the stunning view we were greeted with straight from our room was the cherry on top. Our time here was so fantastic that we're seriously considering a return trip! For anyone considering a stay in the area, look no further. This place is a guaranteed 10/10, and we wholeheartedly recommend it. Thank you, Del & Judy, for an exceptional experience!

review_text: This is a great find for the area. We used this space as a staging area to hike around Crater Lake, and it worked perfectly for that. If you're looking to vacation in the area or just passing through and don't want to deal with being in the middle of Klamath Falls, it's a great spot. While it's definitely a private space, you're within ten minutes of Klamath Falls' city center, and the view in the morning is unbeatable. The room is extraordinarily well-furnished with a fully stocked coffee nook, and Del and Judy are great hosts- we were were greeted to a blueberry muffin on arrival, making us feel right at home.

review_text: Had a very comfortable stay. The area was beautiful and I could hear an owl near the house at night. The room was very warm and comfortable and had plenty of amenities to enjoy. I loved drinking tea and relaxing in the very comfortable bed that was provided. The one thing that could be improved would be a higher quality door between the airbnb space and the rest of the house. I could clearly hear the TV/conversation and dishes clanking next door which was unexpected. If there were a note in the listing about the noise traveling easily between the spaces then that would have been better (I did note that there were quiet hours that started at 10pm but a clearer note would be helpful). I was studying in the room in the evenings and luckily travel with a white noise machine, otherwise it would have been more of an issue. I do think a higher quality door would help to keep more of the noise out of the space. Thanks for the comfortable visit!

name: Glen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I could live here. The house is well laid out, roomy, spacious for its size, comfortable - it flows nicely. The backyard is a private space, a great place to relax. The view out the front - the lake - is delightful, especially at sunset. It doesn’t feel like, “I can make this place work as a short-term rental.” Instead, it feels like a well-furnished home you just moved into.
It was hard to leave. It’s in a quiet neighborhood, easy access to the nearby parks, and a short drive to downtown spots. We had no issues at all with the house - everything worked, everything we needed, good lighting (which is surprisingly uncommon in rentals), TV was easy to work (again, not the norm), able to recycle, great showers, comfortable beds. Exceeded the expectations of all 4 of us. We felt lucky to stay there, and I looked like a genius for having booked it.
Should I stop raving now?

review_text: We absolutely loved this place! We came to the Klamath Falls area to do bird photography in the Klamath/Tulelake Wildlife Refuges and the quantity and variety of birds was simply outstanding. It was wonderful to have this place to return to after 10 hour days looking for birds. The place is easy to find, spotlessly clean, and attractively decorated. It looks directly across the street to the lake so we had lovely sunset and sunrise views. The street it is on is very quiet. The kitchen is very well equipped with anything you might need. Since we wanted to get early starts in the morning, we appreciated having two bathrooms. We definitely will return to the area for more birding and photography and will absolutely book this place again. Two thumbs way up!

Plenty of sitting space by the window overlooking the lake. We were a group of 3 and had more than enough space. This is a great place to quarantine and work from home too. The internet is super reliable. The place is very well maintained and super clean. We did not see any insects or dusty corners. All the beds (including the sofa bed) was comfortable and clean. There's plenty of closet space and storage and we had everything we needed. Erica is responsive and a great host. This will be a definite go to place to stay when in this area.

The property is a good base to visit Crater Lake, being only about 1 hour from the park. There is a grocery store and gas station just down the road. Everything was very clean when we arrived and the parking is off the road which is nice. Valerie was very quick to respond to any questions we had. We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again if we come back to this area.

Valerie was a terrific hostess. She absolutely anticipates what her guests might need, and has it available for them. It's the first time we've ever been to an Airbnb that has a first aid kit; that's impressive!
The location is an hour from Crater Lake and 40 minutes away from Lava Beds National Monument in California; both great places to visit. There are also two wildlife refuges nearby.
I recommend cooking when you get to Valerie's place. There is a Fred Myer grocery store four minutes from the house, and her kitchen has all the supplies you need to make a nice home cooked meal.
The beds were comfy, and the living room has plenty of room for a family to watch something on tv together. We loved being here.

review_text: Valerie has done a wonderful job of creating a comfortable, cozy home. It was clean, decorated very tastefully, and spacious. Valerie has thought of everything her guests might need, from kitchen supplies, a perfect coffee bar, a snack basket, washer and dryer with laundry pods, chilled mugs, a grill, and so much more. The location is on a busy road so it's a bit noisy, but is on a fenced lot set back a bit from the road, so that helps keep it from being too loud, and we weren'treally bothered by the noise. Valerie responded quickly to any questions we had. Nights were cold the week we were here and the furnace ran a lot, and was a bit loud, but we were very thankful for the warmth! We will definitely stay again when we return to visit family in Klamath Falls!

The bed in the master bedroom was comfortable. The heater worked great. I didn't have the occasion/need to use any A/C due to it being winter. There were plenty of towels for the bathroom. The shower heated up nicely and had great water pressure. Valerie communicated everything clearly from the beginning. She also messaged me the morning after the first night (at a reasonable hour) to check-in and make sure that everything was good. A main benefit for me was that it was really close to the family I was visiting. I would definitely rent from her again.

name: Glen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We had a great stay in Klamath Falls while we visited Crater Lake N.P. It was about a 60 minute drive to Crater Lake, but it was no problem. The house itself was a little hard to pick out from the road (every time we came back from the park or the store we would be saying to ourselves "now which one is it?", but that might just be us. The house itself was very convenient to the main drag and to big grocery stores and other forms of civilization. We ate all our meals at home so I cannot speak for the presence or quality of nearby restaurants -- it just wasn't on our radar.
Entry and exit via the keypad on the front door was easy. The book containing description of amenities was very clear (lots of photos) and the house rules and check-out requirements were minimal and sensible. Valerie provides some bottled water and snacks for her guests, which was a nice touch. She had plenty of pots and pans and cooking necessities. The gas grill was clean, relatively new, and easy to operate.
The house was clean and had two window-unit type air conditioners running when we got there. The temp outside was near 90, but I was a little too cool while sitting and watching the TV (in short, the A/C works!). The beds were comfortable and quiet - we had a couple in the main room, one in the second bedroom and one on the sofa bed. No complaints from anyone. The neighborhood was also quiet - no issues there.
There was one bathroom in the home that everyone shared and it was fine. Towels were soft and of good quality. Water pressure wasn't great from the sinks, but the shower was fine.
All in all, this is a great place to stay if you are in the Klamath Falls area. Highly recommended!

The place is clean, cozy, and warm which was perfect since we stayed in the middle of winter and had all the little extra amenities you would need to make it feel like home away from home.
It is located on a busy road but both the bedrooms are in the back so you don't hear much road noise plus there is a huge front and back yard. Plenty of parking and the property was kept up nicely so when we arrived the driveway and walkway was clear of snow. Super nice touch!

review_text: We had a fabulous stay! The place is charming, very clean, comfortable, and WELL stocked. The snack basket and water bottles were a nice touch. The house/guide book was very detailed with everything you need to know about the home and the area. Valerie's responses were timely. When I booked, I had inquired about the weather (thinking that there could be some snow). She let me know what she thought the weather would be and then without me asking, she was kind enough to give me an update on the weather a few days before our arrival. Now that's service, with a capital S. This is a perfect location for visiting Crater Lake National Park and exploring the quaint town of Klamath Falls. We would definitely book Valerie's place again.

review_text: Love this place for the value and the thoughtful touches. For the price of a decent hotel room, I get a clean, nicely decorated mobile home with two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a large yard with a play set for the kids. There are lots of little touches that show the thoughtfulness of the host like glasses chilling in the fridge, to-go cups for my coffee, lamps with USB plugs so I don’t have to dig for an outlet, etc. This is the first place I check for availability when I’m going through Klamath Falls.

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Valerie’s place was GREAT! We only got to stay one night passing over on our way to Mount Hood. It was a 100 degree day when we were there and there was an AC in the living room and one in each of the bedrooms. When we walked in the place was perfectly cool! It had all the amenities and everything you could need. The coffee “bar” was such a thoughtful touch, lots of snacks, all the utensils and cookware you could need. Very clean too! WiFi info was easily accessible, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon prime etc on the TV. Pack & play with sheets for our toddler and she offered us a high chair too. Every detail was covered right down to frosty mugs in the freezer for a beer at the end of a long hot day! We would absolutely stay here again and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this place to anyone traveling to Klamath Falls!

My husband and I had such an amazing stay in Luke's beautiful home! Some of our highlights included:
-Felt right at home, very safe, private and didn't hear any noise around us
-The place was very clean, pristine and had all the amenities we could have possibly needed. It was very spacious too, nice tub and water pressure.
-Super comfy bed, great wifi, and awesome to have a washer/dryer right in the unit
-Best of all was the location! You are just a quick walk to cute little the downtown area, which has lots of cute shops, restaurants and bars. We would absolutely love to stay here the next time we're in Klamath Falls! 11/10!!!

Rating, 4 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cascadia Cottage is a comfortable place to stay. I especially appreciated the black-out curtains and the peaceful quiet of the neighborhood. Though the weather was chilly outside, the house was cozy inside and the heat was easy to adjust. I also appreciate that this Airbnb is hosted by an individual person (not a property management company), and that Luke takes the time to communicate on a personal level. As he mentioned below, the TV is brand-new, and Luke generously offers access to Netflix, Hulu, HBOMax, etc. All in all, the home is a great value, and it was a nice and easy place to stay while in Klamath.
p.s. If you're a swimmer, the Ella Redkey pool is nearby. It's a large, outdoor pool heated with geothermal energy, and it's open year-round. Swimming laps in the morning with the steam rising off the water is pretty awesome.

My husband and I were visiting Klamath Falls for business. We really enjoyed staying at Cascadia Cottage!
This cozy cottage is very comfortable and spacious, with all the equipment and amenities one could wish for.
Luke was a wonderful host and his communication with us was great.
I would highly recommend this little AirBnB, which is well located in a quiet street, and ideally situated for exploring Klamath Falls and surrounding area.
A big thank you to Luke for making our stay so enjoyable and we hope to be back!

name: Megan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This is a nice place to stay in Klamath Falls, and Luke was very responsive. Descriptions are all accurate, there was plenty of space for two people, and there were lots of extra details that travelers can appreciate (such as toiletries and kitchen essentials provided if needed). Heat works well, and there is good hot water and water pressure. The furniture is functional and laid out well for the space. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but it wouldn't stop us from staying there again if we were in the area. Good internet. The living room TV was temporarily down, but that didn't make a difference to us during our short stay (there's a small one in the twin bedroom if this is important to you and it's still unavailable). We appreciated the easy parking, the easy check in, and there being very few steps to climb with our bags since we got in late and were tired from traveling all day. This was also a much better value than the hotel options available for the weekend.

About hour drive from Lava Beds National Monument and Crater Lake National Park.

review_text: Laryssa was a fantastic host. She was very communicative and sweet, always offering help and insights. It was very apparent that she sincerely wanted us to have a comfortable stay! She accommodated us in a pinch, during the holidays, which was amazing of her! Some notable things from our stay include: it was fairly wheelchair friendly with wide hallways, an open floor plan, and wide bathroom sink entrance. It was also great having a full kitchen with pots and pans, food storage containers, and a full set of spices, as well as full laundry facilities with detergents included, a fenced in backyard for our pup, adjustable air and heat with Nest, and 3 beds to choose from! Which felt very “Goldie Locks & the Three Bears” esque as one was firm, one was soft, and one was right in the middle! This place was perfect for what we needed for the time and again, Laryssa was great!

review_text: We had a great time staying at Jessica’s. A beautiful, clean home with everything we needed, including a very organized and spotless kitchen. We definitely look forward to staying at Jessica’s again!
